instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the study on mapping pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra of minerals using the IELM method?
Output: The study used a spectral library preparation to highlight the perturbation/mixing of pure spectra and incorporated a mathematical formulation to find the perturbed/mixed spectra beyond a threshold. instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the IELM method in mapping pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra of minerals, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the IELM method in mapping pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra of minerals is the percentage accuracy. The relted study states that the IELM method achieves 98.08% accuracy with high signal-to-noise (SNR) valued AVIRIS-NG data and 96.54% accuracy with low-SNR synthetic data in the presence of 269 training samples.

instruction: How does the IELM method compare to the spectral feature fitting approach in terms of accuracy for mapping pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra of minerals using high-resolution hyperspectral remote sensing?
Output: The IELM method is shown to have better efficacy than the spectral feature fitting approach in terms of accuracy for mapping pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra of minerals using high-resolution hyperspectral remote sensing. The IELM method achieves 98.08% accuracy with high signal-to-noise (SNR) valued AVIRIS-NG data and 96.54% accuracy with low-SNR synthetic data in the presence of 269 training samples. This indicates that the IELM method is more accurate in mapping both pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra compared to the spectral feature fitting approach.

instruction: Can the integrated extreme learning machine (IELM) method be used to accurately map pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra of minerals in the Jahazpur mineralised belt using high-resolution hyperspectral remote sensing?
Output: Yes, the integrated extreme learning machine (IELM) method can be used to accurately map pure spectra and perturbed/mixed spectra of minerals in the Jahazpur mineralised belt using high-resolution hyperspectral remote sensing. The IELM method has been successfully applied in the large-scale mapping of the Jahazpur mineralised belt using AVIRIS-NG observation. In the validation process, the IELM method achieved 98.08% accuracy with high signal-to-noise (SNR) valued AVIRIS-NG data and 96.54% accuracy with low-SNR synthetic data, demonstrating its effectiveness in accurately mapping the spectra of minerals in the presence of 269 training samples.
